closed_trades.exit_reason: GTT stop loss triggered - metal sector reversal

exit_indicators.note: Exit at exact stop loss via GTT

what_worked: Automatic exit, no manual intervention needed
what_didnt: Entry timing - bought near day highs
Stop loss too tight for metal stock volatility
key_learnings: Don't chase stocks after big moves - wait for pullback
RSI >65 = avoid entry, wait for dip to 45-55
Metal stocks need 4-5% SL minimum, not 2-3%
Confirm breakout strength next day before entry
Massive volume spike can be exhaustion, not strength
Don't put full capital in one sector

closed_trades.notes: First systematic trades. Good: GTT worked, losses controlled. Bad: Poor entry timing, chased momentum.

closed_trades.exit_reason: GTT stop loss triggered - metal sector reversal

exit_indicators.note: Exit at exact stop loss via GTT

what_worked: Automatic exit, no manual intervention needed
what_didnt: Entry timing - bought after +3.18% intraday move (chasing)
Mid-day entry (1:30 PM) - should enter 9:15-10:30 AM only
Massive volume spike 26.3x was exhaustion, not strength
No pullback waited for despite big move
Stop loss too tight (2.43%) for metal stock volatility
Same sector as HINDZINC - doubled down on metals
key_learnings: Don't chase stocks already up >3% intraday
Volume spike >20x = exhaustion signal, not entry signal
Never enter after 11 AM - wait for next day
Avoid multiple positions in same sector
Metal stocks need 4-5% SL minimum, not 2-3%
Wait for pullback even if RSI is acceptable (was 60.58)

closed_trades.notes: First systematic trades. Good: GTT worked, losses controlled. Bad: Poor entry timing, chased momentum.
